comp_req__bitmanipulation__bitmask_opera.content: The bit manipulation library shall provide type-safe bitmask operations for scoped enumeration types.
comp_req__bitmanipulation__bitmask_opera.title: Support for Bitmask Operators for Enum Classes

comp_req__bitmanipulation__bounds_safety.content: All bit manipulation functions shall validate input parameters and prevent data corruption.
comp_req__bitmanipulation__bounds_safety.title: Bounds and Safety Checks

comp_req__bitmanipulation__header_only.content: The bit manipulation API shall be header-only and not require external dependencies.
comp_req__bitmanipulation__header_only.title: Header-only API

comp_req__bitmanipulation__utilities.content: The bit manipulation component shall provide API for setting, clearing, toggling, and checking bits, as well as extracting bytes and manipulating half-bytes and bytes for any integral type up to 64 bits.
comp_req__bitmanipulation__utilities.title: Support for Bit Manipulation Utilities

comp_req__component_name__some_title.content:
The Component shall do xyz to another component to bring it to this condition at this time

Note: (optional, not to be verified)
sections: <Headlines (for the list of requirements if structuring is needed)>
comp_req__component_name__some_title.title: Some Title

comp_req__containers__deterministic_beha.content: The Containers library shall provide deterministic behavior with no dynamic memory allocation.
comp_req__containers__deterministic_beha.title: Deterministic Behavior

comp_req__containers__dynamic_array.content: The Containers library shall provide a fixed-size array container with construction-time size specification.
comp_req__containers__dynamic_array.title: Dynamic Array

comp_req__containers__intrusive_list.content: The Containers library shall provide an intrusive doubly-linked list based on the C++ standardization proposal P0406R1.
comp_req__containers__intrusive_list.title: Intrusive List

comp_req__containers__non_relocatable_ve.content: The Containers library shall provide a non-relocatable vector container that maintains stable element addresses.
comp_req__containers__non_relocatable_ve.title: Non-Relocatable Vector

comp_req__containers__type_safety.content: The Containers library shall enforce compile-time type safety for all container operations.
comp_req__containers__type_safety.title: Type Safety

comp_req__example_feature__archex_exampl.content: The component shall provide the Logical Operation 4 to get the ..
comp_req__example_feature__archex_exampl.title: Example Component Req

comp_req__feo__act_alloc_error.content:
During initialization (i.e. in the startup function of an activity), activities shall check for resource allocation
and report an error to the executor in case of failure.
comp_req__feo__act_alloc_error.title: Activity resource allocation error

comp_req__feo__act_map_cfg.content: The mapping of activities to threads is done in the component configuration and cannot be changed at runtime.
comp_req__feo__act_map_cfg.title: Activity Mapping Configuration

comp_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.content:
If an activity fails in the shutdown function, the primary process shall shutdown all remaining activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
comp_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.title: Activity shutdown error

comp_req__feo__act_startup_error.content:
If an error occurs during the execution of a startup function, the primary process shall abort calling
startup functions and terminate itself. For all of the activities
whose startup functions have already been called successfully, the corresponding shutdown functions shall be
executed in arbitrary sequence.
comp_req__feo__act_startup_error.title: Activity startup error

comp_req__feo__act_stepping_error.content:
If an activity fails in the step function, the primary process shall call shutdown for all activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
comp_req__feo__act_stepping_error.title: Activity stepping error

comp_req__feo__act_timeout.content:
If a timeout occurs during startup, stepping or shutdown of an activity, the primary process shall shutdown all
successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
comp_req__feo__act_timeout.title: Activity timeout

comp_req__feo__activitiy_step.content:
Each Activity shall be stepped once within each execution of the Task Chain they belong to.
Stepping is done by a call to an activity's `step` function. The `step` function shall be invoked
in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activitiy_step.title: Stepping of Activities

comp_req__feo__activitiy_thread.content:
Each activity shall be mapped to one thread. The mapping cannot be changed at runtime.
Each activity's `init`, `step` and `shutdown` functions shall be executed in the assigned thread.
comp_req__feo__activitiy_thread.title: Mapping of Activities to threads

comp_req__feo__activity.content:
Each activitiy is mapped to exactly one thread within the primary or one of the secondary processes.
Each activity provides the following functions:

* `init`: Initialization of the activity.
* `step`: Execution of the activity.
* `shutdown`: Shutdown of the activity.
comp_req__feo__activity.title: Activity

comp_req__feo__activity_init.content:
Initialization of Activities shall be done during application initialization.

Each Activity shall be initialized by a call to its `init` function.
The `init` function shall be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activity_init.title: Initialization of Activities

comp_req__feo__activity_shutdown.content:
Shutdown of activities shall be done during application shutdown.

Each activity shall be shut down by a call to its `shutdown` function. The `shutdown` function shall be invoked
in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
comp_req__feo__activity_shutdown.title: Shutdown of activities

comp_req__feo__agent.content:
In order to execute activities in secondary processes, the Scheduler shall use agents running in the secondary
processes. There shall be exactly one agent for each secondary process.

The Agent in a secondary process shall receive commands from the Scheduler, invoke actions on Activities within its
process and report back to the Scheduler. Each Activity that is part of the task chain in a secondary process shall
be associated with an Agent, which takes over the task to wait for a trigger from the Scheduler. When the Agent
gets a step request from the Scheduler, it calls the Step function of the Activity.
comp_req__feo__agent.title: Agent

comp_req__feo__alive_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
alive supervision checkpoint to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__alive_supervision.title: Alive supervision

comp_req__feo__application.content:
An application consists of one or more activities executed in one or multiple operating system processes.

In particular it consists of the primary process which handles the lifecycle, configuration and execution management.
It may optionally consist of one or more secondary processes.
The purpose of secondary processes is to run code in separate address spaces (Freedom From Interference) for safety reasons.
Each process (primary and secondary) belongs to exactly one application.
Each process contains one ore more operating system threads.
comp_req__feo__application.title: Application Processes

comp_req__feo__application_lifecycle.content: The Application Lifecycle shall consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.
comp_req__feo__application_lifecycle.title: Application Lifecycle Phases

comp_req__feo__comp_cfg.content:
The component shall provide a configuration mechanism that supports configuring

- the mapping of activities to threads
- the execution order of activities
- when the task chain is activated (e.g. a cycle time for cyclic execution)
comp_req__feo__comp_cfg.title: Component Configuration

comp_req__feo__comp_cfg_file.content: It shall be possible to define the component configuration in a pre-defined configuration file.
comp_req__feo__comp_cfg_file.title: Component Configuration from File

comp_req__feo__deadline_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
deadline supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__deadline_supervision.title: Support of deadline supervision checkpoints

comp_req__feo__logical_supervision.content:
The component shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
logical supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
comp_req__feo__logical_supervision.title: Support of logical supervision

comp_req__feo__response_term_request.content:
If the primary process receives a termination signal, it shall call the shutdown
function of all remaining activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.

If a secondary process receives a termination signal, it shall terminate itself.
comp_req__feo__response_term_request.title: Response to termination request

comp_req__feo__scheduler.content: The component shall implement a scheduler (aka executor) that manages the execution of activities in correct order.
comp_req__feo__scheduler.title: Scheduler aka Executor

comp_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.content:
If not all secondary processes connect to the primary in time, the primary shall terminate itself.
The startup functions shall not be triggered.
comp_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.title: Secondary connection timeout

comp_req__feo__service_activity.content:
The component shall enable the implementation and execution of Service Activities, which are a means to interact
with the outside world, e.g. via network communication, direct sensor input or direct actuator output.

A Service Activity shall be enabled to use APIs external to the framework (e.g. networking APIs, reading from
external sensor devices, writing HW I/O, etc.)
comp_req__feo__service_activity.title: Service Activity

comp_req__feo__startup_timeout.content:
If not all activities reach their initialized state within a certain period of time (startup timeout),
the primary process shall shutdown all successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
comp_req__feo__startup_timeout.title: Startup timeout

comp_req__feo__task_chain.content:
All activities within an application are arranged within a `Task Chain`.
There is exactly one task chain per application.

The task chain configuration defines the execution order of the activities.
In particular it defines when the task chain is activated (typically in a cyclic manner) and in which order the activities will run.

Every task chain may have one or multiple input service activities which will run in the beginning.
The purpose of an input service activity is to collect external input signals and provide them to the other activities during task chain execution.
Every task may have one or more output service activities which will run in the end.
The purpose of an output service activity is to collect signals produced by activities within the task chain and send them to external entities.
comp_req__feo__task_chain.title: Task Chain

comp_req__feo__trustable_computation.content:
The component shall provide mechanisms to check after the computation of
an Activity if the result is trustable.
This can be done e.g. via evaluation of floating point exceptions,
checking of hardware registers or status information of the
software platform.
comp_req__feo__trustable_computation.title: Trustable computation

comp_req__filesystem__api_abstraction.content: The Filesystem library shall provide filesystem API based on the C++ standardization.
comp_req__filesystem__api_abstraction.title: Standard Filesystem Abstraction

comp_req__filesystem__directory_iterator.content: The Filesystem library shall provide directory iterator types for traversing directory contents.
comp_req__filesystem__directory_iterator.title: Directory Iterators

comp_req__filesystem__file_io.content: The Filesystem library shall provide functionality for reading from and writing to files, including buffered I/O operations.
comp_req__filesystem__file_io.title: File I/O Operations

comp_req__filesystem__file_utils.content: The Filesystem library shall provide additional file utility functions, such as temporary file handling and file comparison.
comp_req__filesystem__file_utils.title: File Utility Functions

comp_req__filesystem__full_testability.content:
The public API of the library shall support dependency injection with test doubles.

Note: This enables full testability of the user code.
comp_req__filesystem__full_testability.title: Fully testable public API

comp_req__filesystem__mock_fake.content: The Filesystem library shall provide mock and fake implementations for unit testing and validation.
comp_req__filesystem__mock_fake.title: Mock and Fake Implementations

comp_req__filesystem__path_utilities.content: The Filesystem library shall provide type-safe utilities for path construction and manipulation.
comp_req__filesystem__path_utilities.title: Path Manipulation Utilities

comp_req__json__asil.content: The JSON library shall be ASIL-B compliant.
comp_req__json__asil.title: JSON library ASIL level

comp_req__json__deserialization.content:
The JSON-Library shall provide a service to deserialize JSON data according to RFC8259, i.e.
parse and check for well-formedness.
comp_req__json__deserialization.title: JSON Deserialization

comp_req__json__full_testability.content:
The public API of the library shall support dependency injection with test doubles.

Note: This enables full testability of the user code.
comp_req__json__full_testability.section_name: Full testability for the user facing API
sections: Full testability for the user facing API
comp_req__json__full_testability.title: Fully testable public API

comp_req__json__lang_idioms.content: The public API shall support the idioms of the programming language it is written in.
comp_req__json__lang_idioms.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
comp_req__json__lang_idioms.title: Support for programming language idioms

comp_req__json__lang_infra.content:
The public API shall use core infrastructure of its programming language and accompanying standard libraries,
whenever possible and meaningful.

Note: This includes error handling.
comp_req__json__lang_infra.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
comp_req__json__lang_infra.title: Use programming language infrastructure

comp_req__json__serialization.content: The JSON-Library shall provide a service to serialize user format into JSON data according to RFC8259.
comp_req__json__serialization.title: JSON Serialization

comp_req__json__type_compatibility.content:
The public API shall enforce strict type compatibility. When a user requests a value, the API shall
validate that the requested return type is compatible with the type and value of the stored JSON data.

Note: This includes checking if the stored value exceeds the range of the expected type.
comp_req__json__type_compatibility.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
comp_req__json__type_compatibility.title: Enforce strict type compatibility

comp_req__json__user_format.content:
The JSON-Library shall return parsed data in a compatible user format.

Note: The user format shall be a regular type and not defined within the library.
comp_req__json__user_format.title: Return data in user format

comp_req__memory__address_independence.content: The Memory library shall ensure shared memory data structures remain valid regardless of process virtual address space mappings.
comp_req__memory__address_independence.title: Process Address Space Independence

comp_req__memory__atomic_ops.content: The Memory library shall provide atomic operations on shared memory data for lock-free inter-process communication.
comp_req__memory__atomic_ops.title: Atomic Operations in Shared Memory

comp_req__memory__bounds_check.content: The Memory library shall track and validate memory region boundaries to prevent out-of-bounds access in shared memory.
comp_req__memory__bounds_check.title: Memory Region Bounds Checking

comp_req__memory__deterministic_alloc.content: The shared memory allocation shall provide deterministic behavior with predictable execution time suitable for real-time automotive systems.
comp_req__memory__deterministic_alloc.title: Deterministic Memory Allocation

comp_req__memory__endianness.content: The Memory library shall provide byte order conversion between host and network byte order (big/little endian).
comp_req__memory__endianness.title: Endianness Conversion

comp_req__memory__ipc_sync.content: The Memory library shall provide file-based locking mechanisms for inter-process synchronization and mutual exclusion.
comp_req__memory__ipc_sync.title: Inter-Process Synchronization

comp_req__memory__offset_ptr.content: The Memory library shall provide polymorphic memory resource allocators using offset pointers instead of raw pointers to enable allocation in shared memory regions accessible across multiple processes. The standard library's std::pmr::polymorphic_allocator is not applicable as it uses raw pointers that are invalid when shared memory is mapped at different virtual addresses in different processes.
comp_req__memory__offset_ptr.title: Polymorphic OffsetPtr Allocator

comp_req__memory__resource_registry.content: The Memory library shall provide a global registry for memory resource lookup and management.
comp_req__memory__resource_registry.title: Memory Resource Registry

comp_req__memory__sealed_shm.content: The Memory library shall provide immutable shared memory segments that become read-only after initialization.
comp_req__memory__sealed_shm.title: Sealed Shared Memory

comp_req__memory__shared_containers.content: The Memory library shall provide type aliases for STL containers (vector, map, string) that use offset pointers for shared memory storage.
comp_req__memory__shared_containers.title: Shared Memory Containers

comp_req__memory__shared_memory.content: The Memory library shall provide capabilities for creating, opening and managing shared memory.
comp_req__memory__shared_memory.title: Shared Memory Management

comp_req__memory__string_utils.content: The Memory library shall provide zero-allocation string utilities including splitting, comparison, and compile-time literals.
comp_req__memory__string_utils.title: String Utilities

comp_req__memory__typed_shm.content: The Memory library shall provide type-safe wrappers for typed shared memory objects with compile-time type checking.
comp_req__memory__typed_shm.title: Type-Safe Shared Memory

comp_req__result__deterministic_behavior.content: The Result library shall provide deterministic behavior with no dynamic memory allocation.
comp_req__result__deterministic_behavior.title: Deterministic Behavior

comp_req__result__domain_error_informati.content: The Result library shall support user-defined error domains and error codes.
comp_req__result__domain_error_informati.title: Domain-Specific Error Information

comp_req__result__error_handling.content: The Result library shall provide an error handling mechanism that enables functions to return either successful values ("Get Value") or error information ("Get Error") without using C++ exceptions.
comp_req__result__error_handling.title: Result-Based Error Handling

comp_req__result__exception_free_operati.content: The Result library shall operate without throwing C++ exceptions.
comp_req__result__exception_free_operati.title: Exception-Free Operation

comp_req__result__set_result.content: The Result library shall provide a "Set Result" operation that accepts either a successful value of type T or an Error object.
comp_req__result__set_result.title: Set Result

comp_req__result__std_integration.content: The Result library shall provide conversion utilities to transform Result objects into std::optional<T> types. The conversion shall require explicit handling of error cases before discarding error information, ensuring that errors cannot be silently ignored.
comp_req__result__std_integration.title: Standard Library Integration

comp_req__result__type_safety.content: The Result library shall enforce compile-time type safety for error handling operations.
comp_req__result__type_safety.title: Type-Safe Error Handling

comp_req__utils__base64.content: The Utils component shall provide functions for encoding data to Base64 format and decoding Base64 data back to its original form.
comp_req__utils__base64.title: Base64 Encoding and Decoding

comp_req__utils__deterministic_behavior.content: The Utils component shall ensure that all operations complete in a predictable manner and without dynamic memory allocation.
comp_req__utils__deterministic_behavior.title: Deterministic Behavior

comp_req__utils__scoped_operation.content: The Utils component shall provide a functionality that stores a callback and executes it automatically when the class is destructed
comp_req__utils__scoped_operation.title: Scoped Operation Management

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abo.content: The ``AbiOption`` API shall mirror ``std::optional`` / ``Option<T>`` without introducing extra fields or indirections.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abo.title: AbiOption API

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abo.content: ``AbiOption.is_some`` shall be ``false`` when empty and ``true`` when containing a value.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abo.title: AbiOption is_some flag

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.content: ``AbiString.len`` shall report the current byte count; ``AbiString.capacity`` shall equal the compile-time size ``N``.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.title: AbiString field semantics

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.content: The ``AbiString`` API shall mirror the applicable parts of ``std::basic_string`` / ``String``, but shall not allocate or reallocate memory.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.title: AbiString API

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.content: Any attempt to exceed ``AbiString.capacity`` shall result in a checked runtime error.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abs.title: AbiString overflow check

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.content: ``AbiVec.len`` shall report the current element count; ``AbiVec.capacity`` shall equal the compile-time size ``N``.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.title: AbiVec field semantics

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.content: The ``AbiVec`` API shall mirror ``std::vector`` / ``Vec<T>``, but shall not allocate or reallocate memory.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.title: AbiVec API

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.content: Any attempt to exceed ``AbiVec.capacity`` shall result in a checked runtime error.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__abv.title: AbiVec overflow check

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__ari.content: The ``AbiResult`` API shall mirror ``std::expected`` / ``Result<T, E>`` without hidden storage or pointers.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__ari.title: AbiResult API

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__ari.content: ``AbiResult.is_err`` shall be ``false`` if ``value.ok`` is valid, and ``true`` if ``value.err`` is valid.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__ari.title: AbiResult is_err flag

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__arr.content: For ABI compatibility, fixed-size arrays shall be declared as ``[T; N]`` in Rust and with a wrapper around ``T[N]`` to perform bounds-checking in C++, where T itself conforms to the ABI compatibility rules.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__arr.title: Fixed-size arrays

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__boo.content: For ABI compatibility, the implementation shall restrict boolean types to one byte (``bool`` in Rust) and to the bit patterns ``0x00`` and ``0x01``.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__boo.title: Restrict boolean size

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__cha.content: For ABI compatibility, the Unicode character type shall use fixed-width definitions (``char`` in Rust; wrapper around ``std::uint32_t`` in C++), and shall restrict values to the ranges ``0x0`` to ``0xD7FF`` and ``0xE000`` to ``0x10FFFF``.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__cha.title: Characters

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__com.content: For ABI compatibility, all native types shall be ABI-compatible across compilers (e.g. GCC and Clang) using the same endianness.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__com.title: Compiler-agnostic ABI

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__enu.content: For ABI compatibility, enums shall have an explicit, fixed underlying representation (e.g. ``#[repr(u8)]`` in Rust; ``enum class E : std::uint8_t`` in C++).
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__enu.title: Explicit enum representation

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__flt.content: For ABI compatibility, floating-point types shall be limited to 32-bit (``f32`` in Rust / ``float`` in C++) and 64-bit (``f64`` in Rust / ``double`` in C++); all floating-point representations shall be compliant with IEEE 754.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__flt.title: Limit floating-point sizes

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__int.content: For ABI compatibility, all integer types shall use fixed-width definitions (``uN``/``iN`` in Rust; ``std::uintN_t``/``std::intN_t`` in C++), for N ∈ {8, 16, 32, 64}.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__int.title: Fixed-width integers

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__nop.content: For ABI compatibility, types shall not contain absolute pointers, references, slices, function pointers, vtables, or any language-specific metadata.
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__nop.title: Disallow pointers and metadata

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__prv.title: Provide AbiOption<T>
Provide AbiString<N>
Provide AbiVec<T,N>
Provide AbiResult<T,E>

feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__st_.content: For ABI compatibility, tuples and structs shall preserve field order, use ``#[repr(C)]`` in Rust, and be ``standard_layout`` in C++ (no inheritance or virtuals).
feat_req__abi_compatible_data_types__st_.title: Struct and tuple ABI layout

feat_req__ai_platform__embedded_efficien.content: The platform shall optimize runtime performance and memory usage to meet the constraints of automotive edge hardware.
feat_req__ai_platform__embedded_efficien.title: Efficient Embedded Runtime

feat_req__ai_platform__model_verificatio.content: The platform shall ensure model artifacts are verified via cryptographic signatures before execution, and model loading is restricted to trusted paths.
feat_req__ai_platform__model_verificatio.title: Verified Model Execution

feat_req__ai_platform__qnx_linux_support.content: The platform shall support portable AI components that run on both QNX (ASIL-B) and Linux environments.
feat_req__ai_platform__qnx_linux_support.title: Cross-OS Portability

feat_req__ai_platform__safety_backends.content: The platform shall support deployment of safety-certified inference backends and abstraction layers for ASIL-B use cases.
feat_req__ai_platform__safety_backends.title: ASIL-B ML Inference

feat_req__ai_platform__static_backend.content: The platform shall select inference backends statically at build time to ensure deterministic runtime behavior.
feat_req__ai_platform__static_backend.title: Static Backend Selection

feat_req__ai_platform__workloads_executi.content: The platform shall support the execution of traditional ML models on embedded automotive hardware.
feat_req__ai_platform__workloads_executi.title: ML Execution

feat_req__baselibs__bitmanipulation.content: The base libraries shall provide bit manipulation utilities for low-level operations on integral types.
feat_req__baselibs__bitmanipulation.title: Bit Manipulation Library

feat_req__baselibs__consistent_apis.content: The base libraries shall provide consistent APIs while respecting language-specific idioms.
feat_req__baselibs__consistent_apis.title: Consistent APIs

feat_req__baselibs__containers_library.content: The base libraries shall provide a container library offering additional container types not present in the C++ standard library.
feat_req__baselibs__containers_library.title: Container Library

feat_req__baselibs__core_utilities.content: The base libraries shall include core software utilities and common infrastructure components needed by multiple platform modules.
feat_req__baselibs__core_utilities.title: Core Software Utilities

feat_req__baselibs__filesystem_library.content: The base libraries shall provide a filesystem library with file and directory manipulation functionality.
feat_req__baselibs__filesystem_library.title: Filesystem-Library

feat_req__baselibs__json_library.content: The base libraries shall provide a JSON-Library with parsing functionality.
feat_req__baselibs__json_library.title: JSON-Library

feat_req__baselibs__maintainable_design.content: The base libraries shall be designed for maintainability and code reuse.
feat_req__baselibs__maintainable_design.title: Maintainable Design

feat_req__baselibs__memory_library.content: The baselibs shall provide a memory management library that includes utilities for shared memory operations, polymorphic memory resources, position-independent pointers, endianness conversion, and inter-process synchronization mechanisms.
feat_req__baselibs__memory_library.title: Memory Library

feat_req__baselibs__multi_language_apis.content: The base libraries shall provide APIs for C++, Rust, or both, depending on the requirements of consuming platform components.
feat_req__baselibs__multi_language_apis.title: Multi-Language APIs

feat_req__baselibs__result_library.content: The base libraries shall provide error handling mechanisms that enable development without relying on C++ exceptions.
feat_req__baselibs__result_library.title: Exception-Free Development Support

feat_req__baselibs__safety.content: The base libraries shall implement functionality necessary to support safety-relevant platform components up to ASIL-B for selected functionalities.
feat_req__baselibs__safety.title: Safety Relevance

feat_req__baselibs__security.content: The base libraries shall adhere to secure coding standards to prevent vulnerabilities across platform components.
feat_req__baselibs__security.title: Security Robustness

feat_req__code_generation__definitionlan.content:
The system shall be modeled in YAML-syntax files. This means the system should
use YAML due to the availability of parsers in Rust and C++. The
system should prefer YAML over JSON due to its simpler syntax.
feat_req__code_generation__definitionlan.title: The system uses a human-readable definition language.

feat_req__code_generation__deinitializat.content:
Software Compute Unit instances shall have onInit and onShutdown
called only once during their lifecycle.
feat_req__code_generation__deinitializat.title: Software Compute Units correctly deallocate any dynamically allocated memory in the onShutdown function.

feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.content:
Software Compute Units shall handle any exceptions in dependency
libraries completely inside the standard interface functions. Software Compute Units shall signal an error by returning an Error that contains an ErrorCode other than Success. Software Compute Units shall terminate execution if unhandled exceptions occur.
feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.title: Software Compute Units do not throw exceptions or "panic".

feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.content:
Software Compute Units shall return an Error with a suitable
Errorcode and follow the defined error propagation mechanism to
handle errors. Software Compute Units shall not manage their own
lifecycle.
feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.title: Software Compute Units do not attempt to trigger program termination.

feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.content:
Software Compute Units shall not interfere with their external
lifecycle management by calling their own interface methods
(onInit, onUpdate, onReset, onShutdown). Software Compute Units may
call onReset() from onShutdown() if required for avoiding code
duplication.
feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.title: Software Compute Units do not call their own standard interface methods.

feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.content:
Software Compute Units shall signal transient errors as a failure of
onUpdate. The responsible Software Compute Unit shall trigger
onReset to recover from transient errors based on logic modeled for
the Archetype.
feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.title: Software Compute Units implement transient error recovery mechanisms in onReset.

feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.content: Software Compute Units shall be considered to have failed permanently if they return a failure on onReset.
feat_req__code_generation__error_handlin.title: Software Compute Units signal reset and recovery failures via the Error return value of onReset.

feat_req__code_generation__initializatio.content:
Software Compute Unit Instances shall be considered to have failed
permanently if they fail to initialize.
feat_req__code_generation__initializatio.title: Software Compute Units signal initialization failures by returning an Error indicating failure.

feat_req__code_generation__nomultithread.content:
Software Compute Units shall have a predetermined number of threads
if they spawn any threads at all. Software Compute Units shall not
dynamically spawn and join or detach worker threads.
feat_req__code_generation__nomultithread.title: Software Compute Units do not spawn a variable number of threads.

feat_req__com__acl_for_consumer.content:
The communication framework shall support an Access Control List for the communication partner consuming a service
instance.
An entry in the ACL corresponds to an allowed producer.
feat_req__com__acl_for_consumer.title: Access Control List for consumer

feat_req__com__acl_for_producer.content:
The communication framework shall support an Access Control List for the communication partner offering a service
instance (producer).
An entry in the ACL corresponds to an allowed consumer.
feat_req__com__acl_for_producer.title: Access Control List for producer

feat_req__com__acl_per_service_instance.content: The communication framework shall support an Access Control List per service instance.
feat_req__com__acl_per_service_instance.title: Access Control List per service instance

feat_req__com__acl_placement.content: The communication framework shall support an Access Control Lists in the deployment configuration.
feat_req__com__acl_placement.title: Access Control List Placement

feat_req__com__asil.content: The communication framework shall support safe communication up to ASIL-B.
feat_req__com__asil.title: Communication ASIL level

feat_req__com__async_support.content: The system shall provide asynchronous bi-directional support via multiple queues.
feat_req__com__async_support.title: Asynchronous support

feat_req__com__bi_directional_comm.content: The system shall support bi-directional communication via writable data elements by the client.
feat_req__com__bi_directional_comm.title: Bi-directional communication

feat_req__com__binding_agnostic_api.content:
The public API of the communication framework shall be binding-agnostic.

.. note::
   Binding-agnostic in this context means, that the public API is independent of the binding underneath. E.g., if the binding is exchanged, the public API remains syntactically and semantically unchanged.
feat_req__com__binding_agnostic_api.title: Binding-agnostic public API

feat_req__com__config_notifications.content: Notifications shall be configurable by consumers of data (using flags or watermarks in shared memory from client to producer).
feat_req__com__config_notifications.title: Configurable notifications

feat_req__com__configurable_queues.content: Queues shall be configurable by the client (VM), including the number of elements and buffer allocation.
feat_req__com__configurable_queues.title: Configurable queues

feat_req__com__consistent_data.content: The system shall support consistent data-sets, allowing the consumer to obtain a consistent version of related data items.
feat_req__com__consistent_data.title: Consistent data-sets

feat_req__com__data_corruption.content: Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to corrupt data consumed by partners with higher criticality.
feat_req__com__data_corruption.title: Data Corruption

feat_req__com__data_driven_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a data-driven architecture.
feat_req__com__data_driven_arch.title: Support for Data-driven Architecture

feat_req__com__data_loss.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to drop data before it is consumed by partners with higher
criticality.
feat_req__com__data_loss.title: Data Loss

feat_req__com__data_notifications.content: Notifications for data updates shall be available (virtual IRQs in a VM).
feat_req__com__data_notifications.title: Data update notifications

feat_req__com__data_reordering.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to modify the order of data consumed by partners with higher
criticality.
feat_req__com__data_reordering.title: Data Reordering

feat_req__com__data_repetition.content:
Consumers with lower criticality shall not be able to duplicate data consumed by other communication partners with
higher criticality.
feat_req__com__data_repetition.title: Data Repetition

feat_req__com__depl_config_runtime.content: Deployment configuration shall be read from an integrity-checked configuration file at runtime.
feat_req__com__depl_config_runtime.title: Deployment configuration at runtime

feat_req__com__event_type.content:
An event-type is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name
- a data type

The producer can assign a value to it.
Consumers can subscribe to value-changed events of the element or poll unseen, cached events.
feat_req__com__event_type.title: Event Type

feat_req__com__interfaces.content:
A communication interface consists of a combination of any number of the following elements:

- Event-Types
- Methods
- Signals
feat_req__com__interfaces.title: Communication Interfaces

feat_req__com__lang_idioms.content: Each public API shall support the idioms of the programming language it is written in.
feat_req__com__lang_idioms.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__com__lang_idioms.title: Support for programming language idioms

feat_req__com__lang_infra.content:
Each public API shall use core infrastructure of its programming language and accompanying standard libraries,
whenever possible and meaningful.

.. note::
   This includes error handling.
feat_req__com__lang_infra.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__com__lang_infra.title: Use programming language infrastructure

feat_req__com__lock_free_access.content: Consistent access to data must be lock-free.
feat_req__com__lock_free_access.title: Lock-free access

feat_req__com__lock_free_queue.content: Queues shall support lock-free access to data elements.
feat_req__com__lock_free_queue.title: Lock-free queue access

feat_req__com__method.content:
A method is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name
- a specified application routine with a given set of parameters and a return type

When a communication partner issues a call to the method with the required parameters:

#. it shall invoke the application routine with the provided parameters, and
#. return its result to the communication partner

A method call shall be possible both synchronously and asynchronously.
feat_req__com__method.title: Method

feat_req__com__multi_binding_depl.content: The association of a service instance and the appropriate binding shall be specified in the deployment configuration.
feat_req__com__multi_binding_depl.title: Multi-binding deployment configuration

feat_req__com__multi_binding_support.content:
The communication framework shall support multiple bindings.

.. note::
   A binding performs the conversion of user communication to the respective communication protocol. It does this either directly or via a gateway approach.
feat_req__com__multi_binding_support.title: Multi-binding support

feat_req__com__multi_lang.content: The communication framework shall provide a public API for each supported programming language of S-CORE.
feat_req__com__multi_lang.section_name: User friendly API for information exchange
sections: User friendly API for information exchange
feat_req__com__multi_lang.title: Support for multiple programming languages

feat_req__com__one_way_sharing.content: The system shall support one-way data sharing into a Virtual Machine (VM) for vehicle state read-only for the VM (snapshot state).
feat_req__com__one_way_sharing.title: One-way data sharing into a VM

feat_req__com__producer_consumer.content: Communication shall be cached based on the producer-consumer pattern.
feat_req__com__producer_consumer.title: Producer-Consumer Pattern

feat_req__com__producer_timestamps.content: Producer time stamps shall be available for related data-sets.
feat_req__com__producer_timestamps.title: Producer time stamps

feat_req__com__readonly_vm.content: The consumer (VM) shall have read-only access to the shared data.
feat_req__com__readonly_vm.title: Read-only access for VM

feat_req__com__request_driven_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a request-driven architecture.
feat_req__com__request_driven_arch.title: Support for Request-driven Architecture

feat_req__com__safe_communication.content:
The communication framework shall support safe communication involving communication partners on the same or multiple
criticality levels.
feat_req__com__safe_communication.title: Safe communication over criticality levels

feat_req__com__service_discovery.content:
The communication framework shall provide service discovery to find available services during runtime. Service discovery shall consider version compatibility. Service discovery shall be handled implicitly (where possible).

.. note::
   The service discovery may be restricted/impacted by availability of deployment information.
feat_req__com__service_discovery.title: Service discovery

feat_req__com__service_instance.content:
Multiple service instances shall be able to offer the same interface.

.. note::
   A communication interface that is offered to consumers is called a service instance.
feat_req__com__service_instance.title: Service Instance

feat_req__com__service_instance_granular.content:
The communication framework shall support multiple service instances per software architecture element.

.. note::
   A software architecture element is for example an application, activity, proces, ...
feat_req__com__service_instance_granular.title: Service instance_granularity

feat_req__com__service_instance_names.content:
A service instance is offered under one or more unique names by which it can be discovered.
Names follow a POSIX path style.

.. note::
   The resolution from a service instance name to the protocol-specific identifier is handled by the service
   discovery.
feat_req__com__service_instance_names.title: Service Instance Names

feat_req__com__service_location_transpar.content:
The interface to access service instances is agnostic to the binding used to communicate with the service.

.. note::
   Deployment information may require manual changes based on where the service is located.
feat_req__com__service_location_transpar.title: Service location transparency

feat_req__com__shared_memory.content: The system shall support multiple chunks of shared memory to allow required access control.
feat_req__com__shared_memory.title: Shared memory chunks

feat_req__com__signal.content:
A signal is part of a communication interface and has:

- a name

A client can trigger the signal.
The service instance offering the trigger can:

- wait for the signal to be triggered
- check if the signal was triggered

.. note::
   Signals can not transport data. They are meant to be fast synchronization mechanism with low setup cost. Thus, depending on the location of the communication partners primitives like Linux Signals or QNX Pulses or Hypervisor Signalling APIs may be chosen.
feat_req__com__signal.title: Signal

feat_req__com__stateless_communication.content:
The communication framework shall support stateless communication.

.. note::
   - In case of events, the producer is not aware of its consumers.
   - In case of RPC, the skeleton is not aware of the proxy, this request originated from.
feat_req__com__stateless_communication.title: Stateless communication

feat_req__com__streamed_data.content: The system shall support streamed data based on shared queues (stream of events or data).
feat_req__com__streamed_data.title: Streamed data based on shared queues

feat_req__com__testability_fake_binding.content: The communication framework shall provide a fake binding.
feat_req__com__testability_fake_binding.section_name: Full testability for the user facing API
sections: Full testability for the user facing API
feat_req__com__testability_fake_binding.title: Fake binding

feat_req__com__testability_mock_api.content: The public API shall be fully mockable.
feat_req__com__testability_mock_api.section_name: Full testability for the user facing API
sections: Full testability for the user facing API
feat_req__com__testability_mock_api.title: Fully mockable public API

feat_req__com__time_based_arch.content: The communication framework shall provide API to support a time-based architecture.
feat_req__com__time_based_arch.title: Support for Time-based Architecture

feat_req__com__tracing.content:
The communication framework shall provide infrastructure to enable binding-agnostic, zero-copy, read-only tracing of
communication.
feat_req__com__tracing.title: Support for Tracing

feat_req__com__versioning.content:
The communication framework shall support versioning of service instances:

- Version information of a service instance is binding-specific.
- Version information is provided in the deployment configuration.

.. note::
   Multiple service instances can have the same interface and version.
feat_req__com__versioning.title: Versioning

feat_req__com__zero_copy.content:
The communication framework shall enable Zero-Copy communication without copying to-be-transferred data.

.. note::
   It has to be evaluated on binding level if a Zero-Copy approach is applicable for the respective binding.
feat_req__com__zero_copy.title: Zero-Copy Approach

feat_req__config_mgmt__central_housekeep.content: Configuration Management shall provide a central housekeeping for Parameters.
feat_req__config_mgmt__central_housekeep.title: Central housekeeping for Parameters

feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_modific.content: Parameter values shall be modifiable during runtime regarding modification procedure specific for a parameter kind.
feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_modific.title: Parameter modification

feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_set_acc.content: A Parameter Set shall be accessible via interface using a key-value principle, where user application passes a Parameter Set name to the interface and its value is returned as result.
feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_set_acc.title: Parameter Set access

feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_set_rel.content: Every Parameter shall be contained in exactly one Parameter Set.
feat_req__config_mgmt__parameter_set_rel.title: Parameter relation to a Set

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_initial_quali.content: There shall exist an overall qualifier for all Parameter Sets to indicate the state of integrity checks at the point of time of initial provision of parameters.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_initial_quali.title: Parameter initial qualifier

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_name_unique.content: Parameters names shall be unique for an ECU project.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_name_unique.title: Parameter name uniqueness

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_cfg_conte.content: Parameter Set configuration shall contain a mapping of Parameters to Parameter Sets, Parameter names and default values.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_cfg_conte.title: Parameter Set configuration contents

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_cfg_sourc.content: Parameter Set configuration shall be determined solely by a read-only input source, deployed on the target.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_cfg_sourc.title: Parameter Set configuration source

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_name_uniq.content: Parameters Set names shall be unique for an ECU project.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_name_uniq.title: Parameter name uniqueness

feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_qualifier.content: A Parameter Set shall contain a qualifier to indicate its integrity.
feat_req__config_mgmt__prm_set_qualifier.title: Parameter Set qualifier

feat_req__config_mgmt__provider_interfac.content: Configuration Management shall provide a generic interface, independent of any Parameter definitions, for applications to access Parameters in read-only mode.
feat_req__config_mgmt__provider_interfac.title: Config provider interface

feat_req__config_mgmt__term_parameter.content: An individual vehicle configuration property used for vehicle specific adaptations is called ``Parameter``.
feat_req__config_mgmt__term_parameter.title: Term definition of Parameter

feat_req__config_mgmt__term_parameter_se.content: Group of Parameters which belong to the same functionality and share an integrity protection is called ``Parameter Set``.
feat_req__config_mgmt__term_parameter_se.title: Term definition of Parameter Set

feat_req__daal__com.content: The communication layer should use the IPC Framework
feat_req__daal__com.title: Communication

feat_req__daal__env.content: It should be possible to use the framework with all specified os like qnx and linux
feat_req__daal__env.title: Execution Environments

feat_req__daal__health_error.content: Error and Health Management should be availability
feat_req__daal__health_error.title: Health & Error Management

feat_req__daal__lifecycle.content: Lifecycle of executables should use one generic API
feat_req__daal__lifecycle.title: Lifecycle Interface

feat_req__daal__log.content: Core Logging API should be used
feat_req__daal__log.title: Logging

feat_req__daal__time_based_arch.content: The daal framework shall provide Trigger to support a time-based architecture.
feat_req__daal__time_based_arch.title: Support for Time-based Architecture

feat_req__daal__trigger.content: Singe Shot and Cyclic execution should be possible
feat_req__daal__trigger.title: Trigger

feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter.content: The system shall include a classic diagnostic adapter to translate SOVD requests into UDS commands.
feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter.title: Classic Diagnostic Adapter

feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter_o.content: The classic diagnostic adapter shall support configuration via ODX files that describe the UDS command mappings and behavior per ECU.
feat_req__diagnostics__classic_adapter_o.title: Classic Diagnostic Adapter ODX Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__db.content: The system shall include a diagnostic database to store DTCs, occurrence counts, and associated metadata for fault events.
feat_req__diagnostics__db.title: Diagnostic Database

feat_req__diagnostics__db_persistence.content: The diagnostic database shall store all diagnostic data persistently.
feat_req__diagnostics__db_persistence.title: Diagnostic Database Persistence

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_catalog_agg.content: The Diagnostic Fault Manager shall be configureable via the aggregated fault catalog derived from all fault libraries in the system.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_catalog_agg.title: Fault Catalog Aggregation

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib.content: The system shall include a fault reporting library that provides an interface for applications and platform components to report diagnostic faults including metadata.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib.title: Diagnostic Fault Library

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_catalog.content: The fault library shall provide the ability to define faults via a component fault catalog for the scope of the respective parent component.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_catalog.title: Fault Library Catalog

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_debounc.content: The fault library shall support configurable error debouncing.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_lib_debounc.title: Fault Library Debouncing

feat_req__diagnostics__fault_manager.content: The system shall include a central diagnostic fault manager that aggregates data from fault libraries, provides DTC status to the SOVD server, and interfaces with a persistent diagnostic database.
feat_req__diagnostics__fault_manager.title: Diagnostic Fault Manager

feat_req__diagnostics__internal_com.content: All internal communication between diagnostic components that do not use UDS or SOVD protocols shall be implemented using the S-CORE::COM middleware.
feat_req__diagnostics__internal_com.title: Diagnostic system internal communication

feat_req__diagnostics__oem_plugin.content: The diagnostic system shall provide a plug-in mechanism to include OEM-specific features.
feat_req__diagnostics__oem_plugin.title: OEM Diagnostic Plug In

feat_req__diagnostics__service_app.content: The diagnostic system shall include a base service application (AKA routine) that is triggered by the SOVD Server and used to derive custom service applications.
feat_req__diagnostics__service_app.title: Diagnostic Service Application

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_auth_mgr.content: The SOVD server shall enforce access control and validate client credentials.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_auth_mgr.title: SOVD Server Authentication Integration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client.content: The system shall provide a SOVD client to allow external applications to communicate with the SOVD server.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client.title: SOVD Client

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client_core.content: The SOVD client shall be designed as a reusable core component that can be deployed in off-board, on-board, or cloud environments.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_client_core.title: SOVD Client Deployment Core

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config.content: The system shall provide configuration management for SOVD components, including protocol parameters and security settings.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config.title: SOVD Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config_mgr.content: The SOVD server shall integrate with the S-CORE Configuration Manager to support runtime access and modification of configuration data.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_config_mgr.title: SOVD Server Configuration Integration

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_gateway.content: The system shall include a SOVD gateway to route diagnostic requests between different network domains and protocols.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_gateway.title: SOVD Gateway

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_server.content: The diagnostic system shall include a central SOVD server that exposes diagnostic functionality via a standard REST interface.
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_server.title: SOVD Server

feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_std.content: The SOVD implementation shall conform to the SOVD standard as defined in ISO/DIS 17978 (or the latest available draft or final publication).
feat_req__diagnostics__sovd_std.title: SOVD Standard

feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_odx.content: The UDS2SOVD proxy shall support configuration via standardized ODX files to define which SOVD services are exposed via the UDS interface.
feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_odx.title: UDS2SOVD Proxy ODX Configuration

feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_proxy.content: The system shall include a proxy to translate UDS diagnostic requests to SOVD protocol requests.
feat_req__diagnostics__uds2sovd_proxy.title: UDS to SOVD Proxy

feat_req__example_feature__archdes_examp.content: The feature shall provide the functionality to ....
feat_req__example_feature__archdes_examp.title: Example Feature Req

feat_req__feature_name__some_title.content:
The Feature shall do xyz to the user to bring him to this condition at this time.

Note: (optional, not to be verified)
feat_req__feature_name__some_title.section_name: <Headlines (for the list of requirements if structuring is needed)>
sections: <Headlines (for the list of requirements if structuring is needed)>
feat_req__feature_name__some_title.title: Some Title

feat_req__feo__act_alloc_error.content:
During initialization (i.e. in the startup function of an activity), activities shall check for resource allocation
and report an error to the executor in case of failure.
feat_req__feo__act_alloc_error.title: Activity resource allocation error

feat_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.content:
If an activity fails in the shutdown function, the primary process shall shutdown all remaining activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_shutdown_error.title: Activity shutdown error

feat_req__feo__act_startup_error.content:
If an error occurs during the execution of a startup function, the primary process shall abort calling
startup functions and terminate itself. For all of the activities
whose startup functions have already been called successfully, the corresponding shutdown functions shall be
executed in arbitrary sequence.
feat_req__feo__act_startup_error.title: Activity startup error

feat_req__feo__act_stepping_error.content:
If an activity fails in the step function, the primary process shall call shutdown for all activities
in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_stepping_error.title: Activity stepping error

feat_req__feo__act_timeout.content:
If a timeout occurs during startup, stepping or shutdown of an activity, the primary process shall shutdown all
successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__act_timeout.title: Activity timeout

feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.content:
Each activity is stepped once within each execution of the task chain they belong to.

Stepping is done by a call to an activity's `step` function.
feat_req__feo__activitiy_step.title: Stepping of activities

feat_req__feo__activity.content:
Activities are mapped to threads within primary or secondary processes.
Each activity is mapped to exactly one thread and provides the following functions:

* `init`: Initialization of the activity.
* `step`: Execution of the activity.
* `shutdown`: Shutdown of the activity.

The mapping is done in a configuration file and cannot be changed at runtime.
feat_req__feo__activity.title: Definition: Activity

feat_req__feo__activity_init.content:
Initialization of activities is done during application initialization.

Each activity is initialized by a call to its `init` function.

The `init` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
Note that `init`, `step` and `shutdown` functions will be run in the same thread.
feat_req__feo__activity_init.title: Initialization of activities

feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.content:
Shutdown of activities is done during application shutdown.

Each activity is shut down by a call to its `shutdown` function.

The `shutdown` function will be invoked in the thread to which the activity is mapped.
feat_req__feo__activity_shutdown.title: Shutdown of activities

feat_req__feo__agent.content:
In order to execute activities in secondary processes, the executor makes
use of an `Agent` for each secondary process and possibly also the primary process.
The agent receives commands from the executor, invokes actions on
activities within its process and reports back to the executor.

Each Activity that is part of the task chain is associated with an
Agent, which takes over the task to wait for a trigger from its
corresponding Executor. When the Agent gets a step request from the
Executor, it calls the Step function of the Activity There is exactly
one agent for each secondary process. The primary can but doesn't have to be
associated with an agent.
feat_req__feo__agent.title: Definition: Agent

feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
alive supervision checkpoint to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__alive_supervision.title: Alive supervision

feat_req__feo__application.content:
An application consists of one or more activities.

An application consists of one or more operating system processes.
In particular it consists of the primary process which handles the lifecycle, configuration and execution management.
It may optionally consist of one or more secondary processes.
The purpose of secondary processes is to run code in separate address spaces (Freedom From Interference) for safety reasons.
Each process (primary and secondary) belongs to exactly one application.
Each process contains one ore more operating system threads.
feat_req__feo__application.title: Definition: Application

feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.content: The Application Lifecycle consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.
feat_req__feo__application_lifecycle.title: The lifecycle of an `Application` consists of 3 phases: Init, Run and Shutdown.

feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
deadline supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__deadline_supervision.title: Support of deadline supervision checkpoints

feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.content:
The framework shall provide the functionality to enable the reporting of
logical supervision checkpoints to an external health management system
(e.g. watchdog)
feat_req__feo__logical_supervision.title: Support of logical supervision

feat_req__feo__response_term_request.content:
If the primary process receives a termination signal, it shall call the shutdown
function of all remaining activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.

If a secondary process receives a termination signal, it shall terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__response_term_request.title: Response to termination request

feat_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.content:
If not all secondary processes connect to the primary in time, the primary shall terminate itself.
The startup functions shall not be triggered.
feat_req__feo__secondary_conn_timeout.title: Secondary connection timeout

feat_req__feo__service_activity.content:
* Service activities are a means to interact with the outside world, e.g. via
  network communication, direct sensor input or direct actuator output
* Service activities may also use APIs external to the framework
  (e.g. networking APIs, reading from external sensor devices, writing HW I/O, etc.)
feat_req__feo__service_activity.title: Definition: Service Activity

feat_req__feo__startup_timeout.content:
If not all activities reach their initialized state within a certain period of time (startup timeout),
the primary process shall shutdown all successfully started activities in arbitrary sequence and terminate itself.
feat_req__feo__startup_timeout.title: Startup timeout

feat_req__feo__task_chain.content:
All activities within an application are arranged within a `Task Chain`.
There is exactly one task chain per application.

The task chain configuration defines the execution order of the activities.
In particular it defines when the task chain is activated (typically in a cyclic manner) and in which order the activities will run.

Every task chain may have one or multiple input service activities which will run in the beginning.
The purpose of an input service activity is to collect external input signals and provide them to the other activities during task chain execution.
Every task may have one or more output service activities which will run in the end.
The purpose of an output service activity is to collect signals produced by activities within the task chain and send them to external entities.
feat_req__feo__task_chain.title: Definition: Task Chain

feat_req__feo__trustable_computation.content:
The framework shall provide mechanisms to check after the computation of
an Activity if the result is trustable.
This can be done e.g. via evaluation of floating point exceptions,
checking of hardware registers or status information of the
software platform.
feat_req__feo__trustable_computation.title: Trustable computation

feat_req__gen_ai__structured_vapi.content: The platform shall provide structured APIs (e.g., via MCP) to access vehicle state and invoke safe vehicle commands.
feat_req__gen_ai__structured_vapi.title: Structured Vehicle Interface

feat_req__gen_ai__ui.content: The platform shall provide a Prompting Interface for GenAI-based agents, enabling structured prompts, streaming output, and context-aware user interaction.
feat_req__gen_ai__ui.title: GenAI Interaction Layer

feat_req__gen_ai__validator.content: The platform shall validate all LLM-generated actions via domain-specific policies before they are executed.
feat_req__gen_ai__validator.title: GenAI Action Validation

feat_req__gen_ai__workloads_execution.content: The platform shall support the execution of Generative AI models (e.g., LLMs) on embedded automotive hardware.
feat_req__gen_ai__workloads_execution.title: GenAI Execution

feat_req__ipc__availability.content:
The IPC binding shall ensure availability of its communication, so that the availability is independent per
criticality level.
feat_req__ipc__availability.title: IPC Availability

feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.content: The IPC binding shall ensure confidentiality of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__confidentiality.title: IPC Confidentiality

feat_req__ipc__integrity.content: The IPC binding shall ensure integrity of its communication.
feat_req__ipc__integrity.title: IPC Integrity

feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.content: IPC communication shall be possible without copying to-be-transferred data.
feat_req__ipc__zero_copy.title: Zero-Copy Approach

feat_req__lifecycle__aslr_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching process with
:term:`ASLR` (Address Space Layout Randomization).
feat_req__lifecycle__aslr_support.title: ASLR support

feat_req__lifecycle__capability_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`
with configured OS-specific capabilities and privileges.
feat_req__lifecycle__capability_support.title: Process capability support

feat_req__lifecycle__central_default_def.content: The Launch Manager shall be able to centrally define defaults for specific properties for the set of executables.
feat_req__lifecycle__central_default_def.title: Global process properties

feat_req__lifecycle__check_dependency_ex.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method to check if at least one dependency has been executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__check_dependency_ex.title: Condition check based on at least one dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__clustering_modules_.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to clustering set of components
as modules.
feat_req__lifecycle__clustering_modules_.title: Module support

feat_req__lifecycle__cond_process_start.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to conditionally start a process
or process group based on the return value of a single or multiple :term:`Processes <Process>`
executed before.
feat_req__lifecycle__cond_process_start.title: Conditionally launch of processes

feat_req__lifecycle__condition_check_met.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check based on process state.
feat_req__lifecycle__condition_check_met.title: Condition check based on status

feat_req__lifecycle__config_actions_cond.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to configure actions based on condition evaluation i.e. to be able to configure SUCCESS and FAILURE case.
feat_req__lifecycle__config_actions_cond.title: Configuration of action based on condition evaluation

feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_timeou.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for configurable timeout
:term:`Interval` to wait for the process to be stopped.
feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_timeou.title: Stop timeout

feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_wait_t.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for configurable wait time
that shall elapse before repeating :term:`Recovery Action`.
feat_req__lifecycle__configurable_wait_t.title: Monitoring and recovery: recovery wait time

feat_req__lifecycle__consistent_dependen.content: The Launch Manager shall reject an inconsistent definition of set of executables dependencies.
feat_req__lifecycle__consistent_dependen.title: Invalid dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__control_commands.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for commands to control
component states.
feat_req__lifecycle__control_commands.title: Control commands

feat_req__lifecycle__controlif_status.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to report status on components via the
:term:`Control Interface`.

Note: status can be "started/running/degraded" - refer to documentation for details
feat_req__lifecycle__controlif_status.title: Report "started/running/degraded"

feat_req__lifecycle__custom_cond_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to wait for configurable custom
conditions, which can be signaled from applications via :term:`Control Interface`.
feat_req__lifecycle__custom_cond_support.title: Control interface support

feat_req__lifecycle__cwd_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given :term:`Working Directory`.
feat_req__lifecycle__cwd_support.title: CWD support

feat_req__lifecycle__dag_logging_control.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide the possibility to log the :term:`DAG`
in a human readable format, triggered via :term:`Control Interface`.
feat_req__lifecycle__dag_logging_control.title: Logging DAG

feat_req__lifecycle__debug_support.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching process with a
given set of debug arguments in debug mode.
feat_req__lifecycle__debug_support.title: Launching process in debug mode

feat_req__lifecycle__define_swc_dependen.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to define for each :term:`SWC` (Software Components), its dependencies.
feat_req__lifecycle__define_swc_dependen.title: Condition check for each SWC its dependencies

feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_check.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method to check if all dependencies have been executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_check.title: Condition check based on all dependency

feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_visu.content: The Launch Manager shall have the means to log the current dependencies in a format that can be visualized when requested.
feat_req__lifecycle__dependency_visu.title: Configuration dependency view

feat_req__lifecycle__deps_visualization.content: The Launch Manager shall have the means to generate the specified dependencies in a format that can be visualized.
feat_req__lifecycle__deps_visualization.title: Configuration Dependency view

feat_req__lifecycle__detach_parent_proce.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process to
detach from parent.
feat_req__lifecycle__detach_parent_proce.title: Process detach from parent support

feat_req__lifecycle__drop_supervsion.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to dropping all surveillance
and failure reaction activities of :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__drop_supervsion.title: Dropping process responsibility

feat_req__lifecycle__env_variable_cond_c.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check for environment variable.
feat_req__lifecycle__env_variable_cond_c.title: Condition check based on ENV

feat_req__lifecycle__ext_monitor_notify.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for external monitors to get
notified on process life status.
feat_req__lifecycle__ext_monitor_notify.title: Process state notification

feat_req__lifecycle__failure_detect.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to detect and react to failure of the
process launch.
feat_req__lifecycle__failure_detect.title: Process launch monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__fast_shutdown_suppo.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support fast shutdown by terminating itself
without affecting the started :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__fast_shutdown_suppo.title: Fast shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__fd_inheritance.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with
given :term:`File Descriptor` inheritance restrictions.
feat_req__lifecycle__fd_inheritance.title: File descriptor inheritance support

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_manager_shut.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support normal shutdown by terminating all
process in the dependency order.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_manager_shut.title: Normal shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_priority_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given priority.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_priority_sup.title: Process priority support

feat_req__lifecycle__launch_support.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__launch_support.title: Support for launching processes

feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_exit_shutd.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall exit after performing shutdown operation by
stopping all the :term:`Processes <Process>` it owns in the dependency order when requested.
feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_exit_shutd.title: Launch Manager shutdown

feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_status_sto.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a way to store the status of the launched process.
feat_req__lifecycle__launcher_status_sto.title: Launched Process status

feat_req__lifecycle__lazy_check.content: The Launch Manager shall check availability of executables in the filesystem only when the executable shall required to be executed.
feat_req__lifecycle__lazy_check.title: Lazy check of configured commands

feat_req__lifecycle__liveliness_detectio.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to detect and react to loss of
:term:`Liveliness` of the :term:`Processes <Process>` it owns.
feat_req__lifecycle__liveliness_detectio.title: Process liveliness detection

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_cfg.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall support configuring the :term:`Interval` of
the internal health check executions.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_cfg.title: Launch manager external monitoring configuration

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_not.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall trigger a notification to an external
:term:`Watchdog` for each successful self monitoring test execution.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_watchdog_not.title: Launch manager external watchdog notification

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_wdg_failed_t.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall not trigger an external :term:`Watchdog`
notification if an internal health check failed.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_ext_wdg_failed_t.title: Launch manager external watchdog notification - failed test

feat_req__lifecycle__lm_self_health_chec.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` shall implement time based cyclical monitoring of itself.
feat_req__lifecycle__lm_self_health_chec.title: Launch manager self health check

feat_req__lifecycle__log_timestamp.content: The :term:`Launch Manager` logs shall contain timestamp information.
feat_req__lifecycle__log_timestamp.title: Logging timestamp

feat_req__lifecycle__modular_config_supp.content: The launch manager shall provide modular configuration file support to configure process attributes.
feat_req__lifecycle__modular_config_supp.title: Configuration file support

feat_req__lifecycle__monitor_abnormal_te.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for monitoring abnormal
termination of :term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__monitor_abnormal_te.title: Process crash monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__monitoring_processe.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for monitoring adopted
:term:`Processes <Process>`.
feat_req__lifecycle__monitoring_processe.title: Monitoring and recovery: adopted process monitoring

feat_req__lifecycle__multi_instance_supp.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to run in multiple instances with its
own configurations on a system.
feat_req__lifecycle__multi_instance_supp.title: Multi-instance

feat_req__lifecycle__multi_start_support.content: The Launch Manager shall permit an executable to be launched more than once.
feat_req__lifecycle__multi_start_support.title: Multiple instance of executable

feat_req__lifecycle__oci_compliant.content: The Launch Manager shall be compliant to the `OCI Specification v1.2.0 <https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/releases/tag/v1.2.0>`__.
feat_req__lifecycle__oci_compliant.title: OCI Compliant

feat_req__lifecycle__offline_config_vali.content: The Launch Manager shall have a means to validate the configuration offline.
feat_req__lifecycle__offline_config_vali.title: Configuration Verification tool

feat_req__lifecycle__parallel_launch_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching :term:`Processes <Process>`
in parallel.
feat_req__lifecycle__parallel_launch_sup.title: Launching processes in parallel

feat_req__lifecycle__path_condition_chec.content: The Launch Manager shall provide a method for condition check for a path.
feat_req__lifecycle__path_condition_chec.title: Condition check based on path

feat_req__lifecycle__polling_interval.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for per condition configurable
:term:`Polling Interval` for launch conditions to be checked.
feat_req__lifecycle__polling_interval.title: Conditional launch polling interval

feat_req__lifecycle__process_failure_rea.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall be able to react to a process failure by
optionally performing one of relaunching the process, stopping the process,
stopping the process and starting another process, or triggering :term:`QNX`
:term:`Operating System` (:term:`QOS`) Device Safe State (:term:`DSS`).
feat_req__lifecycle__process_failure_rea.title: Recovery

feat_req__lifecycle__process_input_outpu.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support to pass the output of one or
multiple :term:`Processes <Process>` as input arguments to another process.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_input_outpu.title: Forward process information

feat_req__lifecycle__process_launch_args.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for launching a process with a
given set of arguments.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_launch_args.title: Handling process args

feat_req__lifecycle__process_logging_sup.content:
The :term:`Launch Manager` shall provide support for logging process launches,
:term:`Processes <Process>` exit/recovery, internal tasks, and interaction with external monitor.
feat_req__lifecycle__process_logging_sup.title: Logging state transitions

feat_req__lifecycle__process_monitoring.content:
